page.title: 12Adam Sedgwick 1785_1873
page.content: Adam Sedgwick was born on March 22nd 1785 in the Old Parsonage Dent.He was educated at the Grammar School in Dent,Sedbergh Public School,and Cambridge University.Adam qualified as a minister of the Church of England like his father,but he was so interested in rocks and fossils, finding many fascinating specimens in his beloved Dentdale,that he became the founder of Geology.Every river, field and route Adam knew along with the Dales folk,he was a lover of the countryside where he was born and bred.Queen Victoria was a friend of his so was William Wordsworth. Woodwardian Professor of Cambridge, Adam Sedgwick died in 1873,being buried in Trinity College Chapel and having a Shap granite fountain built in the Main Street Dent as a living Memorial to him.
